verses.roman:
daśa-vipra anna rāndhi' kare eka stūpa
janā-pāṅca rāndhe vyañjanādi nānā sūpa

synonyms: daśa-vipra—ten brāhmaṇas; anna—food grains; rāndhi'-cooking; kare—do; eka stūpa—in one stack; janā-pāṅca—five brāhmaṇas; rāndhe—cook; vyañjana-ādi—vegetables; nānā—various; sūpa—liquid.
translation: Ten brāhmaṇas cooked the food grains, and five brāhmaṇas cooked both dry and liquid vegetables.
